page.title: 05The Bridestones
page.content: The Bridestones is around 4000 years old and it was probably used to bury a chief or another important person.He would have been cremated and buried in an urn.There was a notice near the Bridestones protecting them, this is what it said 'This ancient burial chamber is protected as a monument of national importance under the ancient monument act 1913-1953 the ministry of works'.The weather will have worn the stones away so they won't look the same as they were origanally also any possible markings will have worn away.The stone was gritstone and the people who erected them were from the West.The tomb was used to bury more than one person about 10-50 people actually.The tomb measures 16 feet long by 5 feet wide.
